result.execSummary:
The defendant Josiah J. NOVOTNY was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstruct Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Under the Huber Law, consecutive to the sentence imposed on count 5 in 16 CF 193.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Josiah J. NOVOTNY

defendant.name: NOVOTNY, Josiah J.
defendant.address: c/o Manitowoc County Jail, Manitowoc, WI 54220

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order Modifying Sentence ordering that defendant's Huber Privileges be withdrawn on these files through his release date.

Defendant in custody.
GUILTY plea entered to count 3, obstruct officer.  Convicted.
The State moves to dismiss and read in counts 1 and 2.  Motion granted.
The defendant is sentenced to the Manitowoc County Jail for thirty (30) days, under the Huber Law, consecutive to the sentence imposed on count 5 of 16 CF 193.
Court costs are waived.
Defendant has 15 days credit.
Minutes.
Plea agreement email between ADA Prost and Attorney Lambrecht.

Defendant in custody.
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed. Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty pleas entered.  Jury calendar.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is set for 01-27-16 at 9:30 a.m.
Plea date is set for 04-13-16 at 3:00 p.m.
Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.
Minutes.
With condition defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant's $500.00 cash bail is amended to $500.00 recognizance bond.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 12-23-15 at 8:30 a.m.   
Minutes.

ADDRESS INFO for Josiah J. NOVOTNY
Current: c/o Manitowoc County Jail, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States  (Effective: 12-04-2015)
Prior: 510 N. 10th Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220 United States

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody on warrant and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 12-14-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $500.00 cash.  Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded to the county jail.  Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail Issued.  Copy filed.
Warrant returned with service of officer thereon.
Minutes.
DEFENDANT'S BAIL TO BE SET AT $500.00 CASH AT BAIL HEARING.

Defendant failed to appear for initial appearance.   Bench warrant authorized.    Court orders bail revoked and $500.00 cash bail to be set at bail hearing.   
Minutes.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of felony bail jumping and resist officer.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 11-30-15 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Minutes.
